title: Proclamation on National Black History Month, 2026
summary: This document is a presidential proclamation designating National Black History Month for 2026. It notes the 250th anniversary of American independence and acknowledges the significant contributions of Black Americans over more than two centuries to the nation's history. It references the recognition of Black American heroes and their enduring impact on American society, culture, and civic life, and frames National Black History Month as a time to reflect on this legacy and ongoing efforts toward equality.

title: Presidential Executive Action on American INDYCAR Racing and American Motor Sports
summary: This presidential action, issued under the President's constitutional and statutory authority, begins with Section 1: Purpose and Policy, describing American INDYCAR racing as a longstanding component of U.S. motor sports and noting speeds over 200 miles per hour. The document outlines the purpose and policy of the action related to American motor racing, reflecting the President's intent to articulate the federal government's position on this sport. The excerpt provided indicates the order is in the format of an executive action with sections starting with a purpose and policy statement. The full text presumably includes further sections detailing implementation or related directives.
